intro: Psychotria sulitii, commonly known as the Philippine Psychotria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are usually red or orange when ripe. Psychotria sulitii is often found in lowland to montane rainforests, where it plays a role in the local ecosystem.
